Used for creating isolated database tables and managing development environments. project_ref: Supabase project ref, defaults to config.project_ref. db_name: Database schema name, defaults to 'public'. timeout: Request timeout in seconds, defaults to 10. Returns: list: A list of tables with their column definitions. Examples: # Get tables for specific session_id >>> session_schemas = await get_schemas(session_id="abc12") >>> print(session_schemas) [ { "table_name": "todo_abc12_tasks", "columns": "id uuid NOT NULL user_id uuid NOT NULL score integer NOT NULL" }, { "table_name": "notes_abc12_items", "columns": "id uuid NOT NULL user_id uuid NOT NULL content text NOT NULL" } ]

Browser.name: Browser

schemas.description: A tool for browsing the web. Don't initialize a new instance of this class if one already exists. Note: If you plan to use the browser to assist you in completing tasks, then using the browser should be a standalone task, executing actions each time based on the content seen on the webpage before proceeding to the next step. ## Example Issue: The details of the latest issue in the geekan/MetaGPT repository. Plan: Use a browser to view the details of the latest issue in the geekan/MetaGPT repository. Solution: Let's first open the issue page of the MetaGPT repository with the `Browser.goto` command >>> await browser.goto("https://github.com/geekan/MetaGPT/issues") From the output webpage, we've identified that the latest issue can be accessed by clicking on the element with ID "1141". >>> await browser.click(1141) Finally, we have found the webpage for the latest issue, we can close the tab and finish current task. >>> await browser.close_tab()

click.description: clicks on an element with a specific id on the webpage.

scroll.description: Scroll the page up or down.

Browser.code:
@register_tool(
    tags=["web", "browse"],
    include_functions=[
        "click",
        "close_tab",
        "go_back",
        "go_forward",
        "goto",
        "hover",
        "press",
        "scroll",
        "tab_focus",
        "type",
    ],
)
class Browser(BaseModel):
    """A tool for browsing the web. Don't initialize a new instance of this class if one already exists.

    Note: If you plan to use the browser to assist you in completing tasks, then using the browser should be a standalone
    task, executing actions each time based on the content seen on the webpage before proceeding to the next step.

    ## Example
    Issue: The details of the latest issue in the geekan/MetaGPT repository.
    Plan: Use a browser to view the details of the latest issue in the geekan/MetaGPT repository.
    Solution:
    Let's first open the issue page of the MetaGPT repository with the `Browser.goto` command

    >>> await browser.goto("https://github.com/geekan/MetaGPT/issues")

    From the output webpage, we've identified that the latest issue can be accessed by clicking on the element with ID "1141".

    >>> await browser.click(1141)

    Finally, we have found the webpage for the latest issue, we can close the tab and finish current task.

    >>> await browser.close_tab()
    """

    model_config = ConfigDict(arbitrary_types_allowed=True)

    playwright: Optional[Playwright] = Field(default=None, exclude=True)
    browser_instance: Optional[Browser_] = Field(default=None, exclude=True)
    browser_ctx: Optional[BrowserContext] = Field(default=None, exclude=True)
    page: Optional[Page] = Field(default=None, exclude=True)
    accessibility_tree: list = Field(default_factory=list)
    headless: bool = Field(default=True)
    proxy: Optional[dict] = Field(default_factory=get_proxy_from_env)
    is_empty_page: bool = Field(default=True)
    reporter: BrowserReporter = Field(default_factory=BrowserReporter)
    url: Optional[str] = Field(default=None)

    _recover_task: Optional[asyncio.Task] = PrivateAttr(None)

    @model_validator(mode="after")
    def valid_page(self):
        if not self.is_empty_page:
            if self.url:
                loop = asyncio.get_running_loop()
                # Create an asynchronous task to perform the recovery in the background to avoid blocking the startup
                task = self._recover_task = loop.create_task(self._recover())

                def callback(task):
                    self._recover_task = None

                task.add_done_callback(callback)
            else:
                self.is_empty_page = True
        return self

    async def _recover(self):
        try:
            await self.start()
            page = self.page
            await page.goto(self.url)
            await self._wait_until_page_idle(page)
            self.accessibility_tree = await get_accessibility_tree(page)
        except Exception:
            logger.exception(f"fail to recover the page {self.url}")
            self.is_empty_page = True

    async def _check_recover(self):
        if self._recover_task:
            await self._recover_task

    async def start(self) -> None:
        """Starts Playwright and launches a browser"""
        if self.playwright is None:
            self.playwright = playwright = await async_playwright().start()
            browser = self.browser_instance = await playwright.chromium.launch(headless=self.headless, proxy=self.proxy)
            browser_ctx = self.browser_ctx = await browser.new_context()
            self.page = await browser_ctx.new_page()

    async def stop(self):
        if self.playwright:
            playwright = self.playwright
            self.playwright = None
            self.browser_instance = None
            self.browser_ctx = None
            await playwright.stop()

    async def click(self, element_id: int):
        """clicks on an element with a specific id on the webpage."""
        await self._check_recover()
        await click_element(self.page, get_backend_node_id(element_id, self.accessibility_tree))
        return await self._wait_page()

    async def type(self, element_id: int, content: str, press_enter_after: bool = False):
        """Use this to type the content into the field with id."""
        await self._check_recover()
        if press_enter_after:
            content += "\n"
        await click_element(self.page, get_backend_node_id(element_id, self.accessibility_tree))
        await type_text(self.page, content)
        return await self._wait_page()

    async def hover(self, element_id: int):
        """Hover over an element with id."""
        await self._check_recover()
        await hover_element(self.page, get_backend_node_id(element_id, self.accessibility_tree))
        return await self._wait_page()

    async def press(self, key_comb: str):
        """Simulates the pressing of a key combination on the keyboard (e.g., Ctrl+v)."""
        await self._check_recover()
        await key_press(self.page, key_comb)
        return await self._wait_page()

    async def scroll(self, direction: Literal["down", "up"]):
        """Scroll the page up or down."""
        await self._check_recover()
        await scroll_page(self.page, direction)
        return await self._wait_page()

    async def goto(self, url: str, timeout: float = 90000):
        """Navigate to a specific URL."""
        await self._check_recover()
        if self.page is None:
            await self.start()
        async with self.reporter as reporter:
            await reporter.async_report(url, "url")
            await self.page.goto(url, timeout=timeout)
            self.is_empty_page = False
            self.url = self.page.url
            return await self._wait_page()

    async def go_back(self):
        """Navigate to the previously viewed page."""
        await self._check_recover()
        await self.page.go_back()
        return await self._wait_page()

    async def go_forward(self):
        """Navigate to the next page (if a previous 'go_back' action was performed)."""
        await self._check_recover()
        await self.page.go_forward()
        return await self._wait_page()

    async def tab_focus(self, page_number: int):
        """Open a new, empty browser tab."""
        await self._check_recover()
        page = self.browser_ctx.pages[page_number]
        await page.bring_to_front()
        return await self._wait_page()

    async def close_tab(self):
        """Close the currently active tab."""
        await self._check_recover()
        await self.page.close()
        if len(self.browser_ctx.pages) > 0:
            self.page = self.browser_ctx.pages[-1]
        else:
            self.page = await self.browser_ctx.new_page()
            self.is_empty_page = True
            self.url = ""
        return await self._wait_page()

    async def view(self):
        await self._check_recover()
        observation = parse_accessibility_tree(self.accessibility_tree)
        return f"Current Browser Viewer\n URL: {self.page.url}\nOBSERVATION:\n{observation[0]}\n"

    async def check_if_page_is_empty(self):
        return self.is_empty_page

    async def take_screenshot(self, url, timeout=90000, save_path="") -> str:
        logger.info(f"Take screenshot for {url}")
        await self.goto(url, timeout=timeout)
        await self.page.wait_for_load_state("networkidle")
        save_path = save_path or f"{TMP}/test.png"
        await self.page.screenshot(path=save_path, full_page=True, type="png")
        return encode_image(save_path)

    async def _wait_page(self):
        page = self.page
        await self._wait_until_page_idle(page)
        self.accessibility_tree = await get_accessibility_tree(page)
        await self.reporter.async_report(page, "page")
        return f"SUCCESS, URL: {page.url} have been loaded."

    def _register_page_event(self, page: Page):
        page.last_busy_time = time.time()
        page.requests = set()
        page.on("domcontentloaded", self._update_page_last_busy_time)
        page.on("load", self._update_page_last_busy_time)
        page.on("request", self._on_page_request)
        page.on("requestfailed", self._on_page_requestfinished)
        page.on("requestfinished", self._on_page_requestfinished)
        page.on("frameattached", self._on_frame_change)
        page.on("framenavigated", self._on_frame_change)

    async def _wait_until_page_idle(self, page) -> None:
        if not hasattr(page, "last_busy_time"):
            self._register_page_event(page)
        else:
            page.last_busy_time = time.time()
        while time.time() - page.last_busy_time < 0.5:
            await page.wait_for_timeout(100)

    async def _update_page_last_busy_time(self, page: Page):
        page.last_busy_time = time.time()

    async def _on_page_request(self, request: Request):
        page = request.frame.page
        page.requests.add(request)
        await self._update_page_last_busy_time(page)

    async def _on_page_requestfinished(self, request: Request):
        request.frame.page.requests.discard(request)

    async def _on_frame_change(self, frame: Frame):
        await self._update_page_last_busy_time(frame.page)

    async def __aenter__(self):
        await self.start()
        return self

    async def __aexit__(self, *args, **kwargs):
        await self.stop()

Previewer.name: Previewer

schemas.description: Preview a project.

preview_project.description: Put a project into preview. You must specify the appropriate preparation commands. Some commands can be None if not applicable or necessary.
preview_project.signature: (self, project_path: str, install: str = None, dev: str = None, build: str = None, build_path: str = None) -> str
preview_project.parameters: Args: project_path: the path to the project install: the command to install the project dev: the command to launch the project (usually as a service) in dev mode build: the command to build the project build_path: the path to the built assets, if applicable, e.g. dist

Previewer.code:
@register_tool(include_functions=["preview_project"])
class Previewer(BaseModel):
    """Preview a project."""

    model_config = ConfigDict(arbitrary_types_allowed=True)

    has_previewed: bool = False
    preview_url: str = ""
    dev_proc: asyncio.subprocess.Process = Field(default=None, exclude=True)
    project_path: str = ""
    use_dev: bool = True  # turn this off for batch testing

    async def preview_project(
        self,
        project_path: str,
        install: str = None,
        dev: str = None,
        build: str = None,
        build_path: str = None,
    ) -> str:
        """
        Put a project into preview. You must specify the appropriate preparation commands. Some commands can be None if not applicable or necessary.

        Args:
            project_path: the path to the project
            install: the command to install the project
            dev: the command to launch the project (usually as a service) in dev mode
            build: the command to build the project
            build_path: the path to the built assets, if applicable, e.g. dist
        """

        # Convert string "None" to None for all parameters
        def convert_none_string(value):
            return None if value == "None" else value

        # Add a handling for Funcsea if not a right project_path
        project_path = project_path.rstrip("/")
        if "/app" in project_path:
            if project_path.endswith("app/frontend") or project_path.endswith("app/backend"):
                project_path = Path(project_path).parent.as_posix()
            install = None
            dev = "bash start_app.sh"
            build = None
            build_path = None

        yaml_config = {
            "install": convert_none_string(install),
            "dev": convert_none_string(dev),
            "build": convert_none_string(build),
            "build_path": convert_none_string(build_path),
        }
        await awrite(f"{project_path}/.mgx/config.yaml", yaml.dump(yaml_config))
        return await self.preview(project_path)

    async def preview(self, project_path: str, config_path: str = ".mgx/config.yaml") -> str:
        """
        Preview a project. The config is a yaml file under the project path in the form of

        install: install command
        dev: command to launch the service in dev mode to check for real-time changes
        build: command to build the project for stable deployment
        build_path: the path to the built assets, if applicable, e.g. dist

        command can be null if not applicable
        """
        # This is a simplified implementation for local testing and should be rewritten.

        if self.has_previewed:
            return "Project already previewed, don't preview it again even if you modify the project."

        if not os.path.exists(f"{project_path}/{config_path}"):
            logger.warning("preview config not found")
            return ""

        with open(f"{project_path}/{config_path}", "r") as f:
            config = yaml.safe_load(f)

        install_cmd = config["install"] or "true"  # do nothing if null
        dev_cmd = config["dev"] or "true"  # do nothing if null
        cmd = f"cd {project_path} && {install_cmd}"
        if self.use_dev:
            cmd += f" && {dev_cmd}"

        logger.debug(f"previewing {cmd}")
        self.dev_proc = await asyncio.create_subprocess_shell(
            cmd,
            stdout=asyncio.subprocess.PIPE,
            stderr=asyncio.subprocess.STDOUT,
            start_new_session=True,  # allows killing all subprocesses when this process is killed
        )
        self.project_path = project_path

        self.has_previewed = True

        return (
            f"Executed: {cmd}. Project previewed successfully. Don't preview it again even if you modify the project."
        )

    async def get_preview_info(self) -> dict:
        from metagpt.tools.libs.browser import Browser

        preview_info = {"screenshot_path": "tmp/test.png", "url": "http://localhost:5173/"}
        # Algorithm self-testing to get screenshots.
        await Browser().take_screenshot(url=preview_info.get("url"), save_path=preview_info.get("screenshot_path"))
        return preview_info

    async def get_url(self) -> str:
        # for local testing
        if self.preview_url:
            return self.preview_url

        if not self.dev_proc or not self.dev_proc.stdout:
            return "No running preview process. Please use preview_project first."

        url_pattern = re.compile(r"http://[^\s]+")

        while True:
            line = await self.dev_proc.stdout.readline()
            if not line:
                break  # EOF or process ended
            decoded_line = line.decode()
            logger.info(decoded_line.strip())

            match = url_pattern.search(decoded_line)
            if match:
                self.preview_url = match.group(0)
                break

        return self.preview_url

    def cleanup(self):
        """clean up all resources"""
        # for local testing
        if self.dev_proc:
            try:
                os.killpg(self.dev_proc.pid, signal.SIGTERM)
                logger.info("Previewer service cleaned up")
            except Exception:
                logger.warning(f"No previewer service to clean up: {traceback.format_exc()}")
            self.dev_proc = None

    async def run_build_preview(self):
        # for local testing
        self.cleanup()  # clean the previous pnpm install process
        cmd = f"cd {self.project_path} && pnpm install && pnpm run build && pnpm preview"
        self.dev_proc = await asyncio.create_subprocess_shell(
            cmd,
            stdout=asyncio.subprocess.PIPE,
            stderr=asyncio.subprocess.STDOUT,
            start_new_session=True,  # allows killing all subprocesses when this process is killed
        )

FrontendEngineer.name: FrontendEngineer

schemas.description: A role who can think and act dynamically

draft_plan.description: Present a development plan to human for confirmation before starting development.
draft_plan.parameters: Args: content: A string containing numbered plan items (e.g., "1. Task A 2. Task B 3. Task C") Returns: str: The human's response/confirmed plan, or error message if format is incorrect

search_template.description: Search for a suitable template to start development. The query should be very concise, focusing only on key points that can impact template selection and leaving out all other details. Key points include the application type (website, app, game, dashboard, slides, video, etc.) and the tech stack, if any (don't specify one if not instructed). Example queries: - web game - personal website with Shadcn-UI and Tailwind CSS - Slides for presentation with Slidev - one simple html web page

FrontendEngineer.code:
@register_tool(include_functions=["search_template", "draft_plan"])
class FrontendEngineer(Engineer2):
    example: str = FE_EXAPMLE

    cmd_prompt: str = FE_CMD_PROMPT
    previewer: Previewer = Field(default_factory=Previewer)
    tools: list[str] = [
        "Editor:read,write,similarity_search",
        "RoleZero",
        "Terminal:run",
        "SearchEnhancedQA",
        "BackendManager",
        "Browser:click,goto,scroll",
        "Previewer",
        "FrontendEngineer",
        "ImageCreator",
        "CheckUI:run",
        "SecretManager",
        "ImageGetter",
    ]
    warning_prompt: str = ""
    image_getter: Optional[ImageGetter] = Field(default=None, exclude=True)

    # Regarding template use:
    # 1. Set use_search_template to False to disable template
    # 2. Set template_tool to FixedSearchTemplate() to skip RAG and use a fixed template
    # 3. Set template_tool to None (unchanged) or SearchTemplate() to perform a full template search
    use_search_template: bool = True
    is_first_dev_request: bool = True
    template_tool: BaseSearchTemplate = None
    template_info: str = GENERAL_WEB_APP_TEMPLATE_PROMPT

    # a larger limit to allow for complex development
    max_consecutive_react_limit: int = 20
    max_react_loop: int = 200

    # Image generation tools
    image_creator: ImageCreator = Field(default_factory=ImageCreator, exclude=True)

    def _update_tool_execution(self):
        super()._update_tool_execution()
        self.tool_execution_map["Previewer.preview_project"] = self.previewer.preview_project
        self.tool_execution_map["FrontendEngineer.search_template"] = self.search_template
        self.tool_execution_map.update({"Editor.write": self.write_check_images})
        self.tool_execution_map["FrontendEngineer.draft_plan"] = self.draft_plan
        self.tool_execution_map["ImageCreator.generate_image"] = self.image_creator.generate_image

        if self.config.useragent.enable:
            self.tool_execution_map["CheckUI.run"] = CheckUI().run

        if ImageGetter.is_available():
            if self.image_getter is None:
                self.image_getter = ImageGetter(project_dir=Path(self.working_dir))
            self.tool_execution_map["ImageGetter.get"] = self.image_getter.get
            self.tool_execution_map["ImageGetter.process"] = self.image_getter.process
        else:
            logger.warning("ImageGetter is not available (missing API key or invalid api_type)")

    @model_validator(mode="after")
    def set_search_template_tool(self):
        if self.template_tool is None and self.use_search_template:
            self.template_tool = SearchTemplate(output_dir=self.working_dir)
            logger.info("SearchTemplate set")
        else:
            logger.warning("SearchTemplate not set")
        return self

    @model_validator(mode="after")
    def set_image_creator_dependencies(self) -> "FrontendEngineer":
        """Set up image creator with necessary dependencies."""
        self.image_creator.working_dir = self.working_dir
        # self.image_creator.image_api_type = "newapi"
        return self

    async def _update_workdir_for_tools(self, new_workdir: str) -> None:
        """Update working directory for all relevant tools including ImageGetter, ImageCreator .

        This ensures ImageGetter creates public/ directory in the correct location
        (e.g., inside prototype_template, not at the workspace root).
        """
        # Update editor (parent class behavior)
        await super()._update_workdir_for_tools(new_workdir)

        # Update image_creator's working_dir
        self.image_creator.working_dir = new_workdir

        # Update ImageGetter's project_dir to the new working directory
        if self.image_getter:
            self.image_getter.update_project_dir(Path(new_workdir))

    async def _think(self) -> bool:
        self.instruction = FRONTEND_ENGINEER_PROMPT.format(
            template_info=self.template_info, backend_info=get_backend_prompt_for_fe()
        )
        self._format_appendix()

        res = await super()._think()
        return res

    def _format_appendix(self) -> str:
        """Format appendix with current paths."""
        if self.rc.memory.appendix:
            return self.rc.memory.appendix

        logger.info(f"Extracted workspace info: {self.working_dir}")
        # Set up file paths based on workspace structure
        workspace = Path(self.working_dir)
        design_docs_dir = workspace / "docs/design"
        tasks_dir = workspace / "docs/tasks"
        if not tasks_dir.exists():
            return ""
        report_docs_dir = workspace / "docs/report"
        alex_todo_filename = tasks_dir / "Alex_todo.md"
        bob_todo_filename = tasks_dir / "Bob_todo.md"
        src_dir = workspace / "app"
        val = APPENDIX.format(
            src_dir=str(src_dir),
            design_docs=str(design_docs_dir),
            bob_todo=str(bob_todo_filename),
            alex_todo=str(alex_todo_filename),
            report_docs=str(report_docs_dir),
            warning_prompt=self.warning_prompt,
        )
        self.rc.memory.appendix = val
        return val

    async def _switch_workingdir_and_update(self, working_dir: Path):
        await self.terminal.run(f"cd {str(working_dir)}")
        self.working_dir = working_dir
        await self._update_workdir_for_tools(str(working_dir))
        logger.info(f"Working directory updated to: {self.working_dir}")
        # update ImageGetter to use the new project_dir

    async def write_check_images(self, path: str, content: str) -> str:
        """Parse the code and check if it contains invalid images paths/URLs. If it does, replace them with the valid images."""

        if path.endswith((".tsx", ".ts", ".js")):
            logger.info(f"Checking duplicate images for script file: {path}")
            # Delegate to image_creator
            content = await self.image_creator.check_and_fix_duplicate_images(content, path)
        else:
            logger.info(f"Skipping duplicate image check for non-script file: {path}")

        # Skip image validation for Markdown files (e.g., todo.md, README.md)
        # These files often contain image filename plans that haven't been generated yet
        if path.endswith((".md", ".markdown")):
            logger.info(f"Skipping image validation for Markdown file: {path}")
            return await self.editor.write(path, content)

        # Use self.image_getter directly (already initialized and updated by _update_workdir_for_tools)
        if self.image_getter is None:
            return await self.editor.write(path, content)

        # Use the abstracted image validation and replacement method
        processed_content = await self.image_getter.validate_and_replace_images(content=content, path=path)

        # Write the processed content to file
        output = await self.editor.write(path, str(processed_content))
        return output

    async def search_template(self, query: str) -> str:
        """
        Search for a suitable template to start development. The query should be very concise, focusing only on key points that can impact template selection and leaving out all other details.
        Key points include the application type (website, app, game, dashboard, slides, video, etc.) and the tech stack, if any (don't specify one if not instructed).
        Example queries:
         - web game
         - personal website with Shadcn-UI and Tailwind CSS
         - Slides for presentation with Slidev
         - one simple html web page
        """
        if not self.is_first_dev_request:
            return "Template search was performed previously. You should develop based on the existing template."

        self.is_first_dev_request = False

        name, todo = await build_from_function_sea(query=query, workdir=self.working_dir)
        if todo:
            await self._switch_workingdir_and_update(Path(self.working_dir).joinpath("app/frontend").as_posix())
            return todo
            # return f"{name} has todo list: `{todo}`, project workdir: `{self.working_dir}`, {name} need to complete ALL the TODO LIST in `{todo}` FIRST."

        # 1. Search for matching template
        template, extra_user_info = await self.template_tool.search(query)
        if template:
            target_dir = await self.template_tool.copy_template(template.template_path)
            source_template_path = template.template_path
            template.template_path = target_dir
            self.template_info = await self.template_tool.get_template_info(
                template_info=template, source_template_path=source_template_path
            )

            # Update template part in instruction
            content = EXRTA_INFO_PROMPT.format(template_name=template.name, target_dir=str(target_dir))
            if extra_user_info:
                content = f"Additional information provided by the user:{extra_user_info}\n\n{content}"
            logger.info(f"Template retrieved: {template.name}")

            # run commands based on template config
            preview_result = await self.previewer.preview(project_path=str(target_dir))
            content += f"\n\n{preview_result}"
            logger.info("Template previewed")

            # switch the role's working directory
            await self._switch_workingdir_and_update(target_dir)

            # inform the role everything is ready
            return content
        else:
            return "No relevant template found"

    async def draft_plan(self, content: str) -> str:
        """
        Present a development plan to human for confirmation before starting development.

        Args:
            content: A string containing numbered plan items (e.g., "1. Task A\n2. Task B\n3. Task C")

        Returns:
            str: The human's response/confirmed plan, or error message if format is incorrect
        """

        # Extract lines without numbers for task list
        lines_without_number = re.findall(r"^\d+\.\s+(.+)$", content, re.MULTILINE)
        user_response = await get_human_input(prompt=content, tasks=lines_without_number)
        result = parse_plan_confirmation(user_response, role="FrontendEngineer")
        return result

ImageCreator.name: ImageCreator

schemas.description: Tools for creating visual content using Gemini 2.5 Flash Image Preview

generate_image.description: Generate an image and save it to the assets directory. Designed to be called as a tool by LLM or internally.
generate_image.signature: (self, description: str, filename: str, style: str = 'photorealistic') -> dict
generate_image.parameters: Args: description: Detailed description of the image to generate filename: Target filename (e.g., "hero-image.jpg", "logo.png") style: Image style (photorealistic, cartoon, sketch, watercolor, minimalist, 3d) Returns: dict: Result with status, path, and message Raises: RuntimeError: If working_dir not set or image generation fails

ImageCreator.code:
@register_tool(include_functions=["generate_image"])
class ImageCreator(BaseModel):
    """Tools for creating visual content using Gemini 2.5 Flash Image Preview"""

    llm: LLM = Field(default_factory=LLM, exclude=True)
    api_key: str = Field(default_factory=lambda: Config.default().llm.api_key)
    base_url: str = Field(default_factory=lambda: Config.default().llm.base_url)

    model: str = "gemini-2.5-flash-image-preview"

    # Image generation API type: "oneapi" or "newapi"
    image_api_type: str = Field(default="oneapi", description="Image generation API type: 'oneapi' or 'newapi'")

    # Image duplicate checking attributes
    image_patterns: ClassVar[list[re.Pattern]] = IMAGE_PATTERNS
    assets_prefixes: ClassVar[FrozenSet[str]] = ASSETS_PREFIXES

    # Instance attributes for tracking
    global_image_usage: dict = Field(default_factory=dict, exclude=True)
    variant_counters: dict = Field(default_factory=lambda: defaultdict(int), exclude=True)

    # working directory
    working_dir: Optional[str] = Field(default=None, exclude=True)
    resource: EditorReporter = Field(default_factory=EditorReporter)

    async def generate_image(self, description: str, filename: str, style: str = "photorealistic") -> dict:
        """
        Generate an image and save it to the assets directory.
        Designed to be called as a tool by LLM or internally.

        Args:
            description: Detailed description of the image to generate
            filename: Target filename (e.g., "hero-image.jpg", "logo.png")
            style: Image style (photorealistic, cartoon, sketch, watercolor, minimalist, 3d)

        Returns:
            dict: Result with status, path, and message

        Raises:
            RuntimeError: If working_dir not set or image generation fails
        """
        if not self.working_dir:
            raise RuntimeError("working_dir not set for ImageCreator")

        try:
            enhanced_prompt = self._build_enhanced_prompt(description, style)
            logger.info(f"Start creating the image. The prompt is: {enhanced_prompt}...")
            assets_dir = Path(self.working_dir) / "public" / "assets"
            assets_dir.mkdir(parents=True, exist_ok=True)
            image_path = assets_dir / filename

            # Choose API based on image_api_type
            if self.image_api_type == "newapi":
                # Note: newapi doesn't support the size parameter
                image_bytes = await self._generate_via_newapi(enhanced_prompt)
            else:
                image_bytes = await self._generate_via_oneapi(enhanced_prompt, size="1024x1024")

            await self._save_image(image_bytes, str(image_path))
            # Report the path only after the image has been successfully saved to ensure the file actually exists.
            self.resource.report(str(image_path), "path")

            logger.info(f"Image created: {image_path}")

            return {
                "status": "success",
                "path": f"public/assets/{filename}",
                "absolute_path": str(image_path),
                "message": f"Image generated and saved to public/assets/{filename}",
                "description": description,
                "style": style,
            }

        except Exception as e:
            error_msg = f"Image creation failed: {str(e)}"
            logger.error(error_msg)
            raise RuntimeError(error_msg) from e

    def _build_enhanced_prompt(self, description: str, style: Optional[str]) -> str:
        """Building enhanced prompt"""
        enhanced = description

        if style:
            style_guides = {
                "photorealistic": "photorealistic, high detail, professional photography",
                "cartoon": "cartoon style, colorful, animated",
                "sketch": "pencil sketch, black and white, artistic",
                "watercolor": "watercolor painting, soft edges, artistic",
                "minimalist": "minimalist design, clean, simple",
                "3d": "3D render, blender, octane render",
            }
            if style in style_guides:
                enhanced += f", {style_guides[style]}"

        return f"Generate an image: {enhanced}"

    async def _generate_via_oneapi(self, prompt: str, size: str = "1024x1024") -> bytes:
        """Generate images by calling Gemini through oneapi

        Args:
            prompt: Image generation prompt
            size: Image size

        Returns:
            bytes: Generated image byte data
        """
        url = f"{self.base_url}/images/generations"

        payload = {
            "model": self.model,
            "prompt": prompt,
            "n": 1,
            "size": size,
            "response_format": "b64_json",
        }

        data = await apost(
            url=url,
            json=payload,
            headers={
                "Authorization": f"Bearer {self.api_key}",
                "Content-Type": "application/json",
            },
            timeout=300,
            as_json=True,
            raise_for_status=True,
        )

        return self._extract_image_from_oneapi_response(data)

    async def _generate_via_newapi(self, prompt: str) -> bytes:
        """Generate images by calling Gemini through newapi

        Args:
            prompt: Image generation prompt

        Returns:
            bytes: Generated image byte data
        """
        url = f"{self.base_url}/models/{self.model}:generateContent?key={self.api_key}"

        payload = {
            "contents": [{"parts": [{"text": prompt}]}],
            "generationConfig": {"responseModalities": ["TEXT", "IMAGE"]},
        }

        data = await apost(
            url=url,
            json=payload,
            headers={
                "Content-Type": "application/json",
            },
            timeout=300,
            as_json=True,
            raise_for_status=True,
        )

        return self._extract_image_from_newapi_response(data)

    def _extract_image_from_oneapi_response(self, data: dict) -> bytes:
        """Extract image data (OpenAI format) from oneapi response

        Expected response format:
        {
            "created": 1234567890,
            "data": [
                {
                    "b64_json": "base64_encoded_image_data",
                    "revised_prompt": "..."
                }
            ]
        }
        """
        data_list = data.get("data", [])
        if not data_list:
            raise RuntimeError("OneAPI returned empty result")

        first_item = data_list[0]
        b64_data = first_item.get("b64_json")

        if not b64_data:
            raise RuntimeError("b64_json data not found in OneAPI response")

        return base64.b64decode(b64_data)

    def _extract_image_from_newapi_response(self, data: dict) -> bytes:
        """Extract image data from newapi response (Gemini native format)"""
        candidates = data.get("candidates", [])
        if not candidates:
            raise RuntimeError("Newapi returned empty result")

        parts = candidates[0].get("content", {}).get("parts", [])
        for part in parts:
            inline_data = part.get("inlineData")
            if inline_data and inline_data.get("data"):
                return base64.b64decode(inline_data["data"])

        raise RuntimeError("Image data not found in newapi response")

    async def _save_image(self, image_bytes: bytes, save_path: str) -> str:
        """Save image to file"""
        save_path = Path(save_path)
        save_path.parent.mkdir(parents=True, exist_ok=True)

        img = Image.open(BytesIO(image_bytes))

        if save_path.suffix.lower() not in [".jpg", ".jpeg", ".png"]:
            save_path = save_path.with_suffix(".jpg")

        img.save(str(save_path), quality=95)
        return str(save_path)

    # ------------------------------------------------------------------
    # Section: Image Duplicate Check and Replacement Logic
    # ------------------------------------------------------------------

    async def check_and_fix_duplicate_images(self, content: str, path: Optional[str] = None) -> str:
        """Check for duplicate images globally and fix them by generating new images.

        Args:
            content: The content to check for duplicate images
            path: Optional file path for tracking usage

        Returns:
            str: Content with duplicate images replaced
        """
        current_image_references = extract_image_references(content, self.image_patterns, self.assets_prefixes)
        if not current_image_references:
            return content

        global_duplicates = find_image_duplicates(current_image_references, self.global_image_usage, path)

        if not global_duplicates:
            update_usage(self.global_image_usage, current_image_references, path)
            logger.info(f"No duplicate images found globally in {path}")
            return content

        logger.warning(f"Found duplicate images in {path}. Fixing...")

        content = await self._fix_global_duplicates(content, global_duplicates)

        final_image_references = extract_image_references(content, self.image_patterns, self.assets_prefixes)
        update_usage(self.global_image_usage, final_image_references, path)

        return content

    async def _schedule_replacement(self, ref: dict, duplicate_path: str, content: str) -> Optional[dict]:
        """Plan a replacement for a duplicate image using contextual generation."""
        context = slice_around_match(content, ref["match"], radius=60)

        new_image_path = await self._generate_replacement_image(original_path=duplicate_path, context=context)

        if new_image_path:
            old_reference = ref["full_match"]
            new_reference = old_reference.replace(ref["path"], new_image_path)
            return {"match": ref["match"], "new_text": new_reference, "new_path": new_image_path}

        return None

    async def _fix_global_duplicates(self, content: str, global_duplicates: dict) -> str:
        """
        Fix global duplicate images by generating replacement items and using reverse substitution.
        """
        replacements = []
        for duplicate_path, refs in global_duplicates.items():
            logger.info(f"Preparing to fix duplicate image: {duplicate_path} (found {len(refs)} references)")

            is_local_only = duplicate_path not in self.global_image_usage

            if is_local_only and refs:
                logger.info(
                    f"Local duplicate only (not used in other files): keeping first occurrence, replacing {len(refs) - 1} others"
                )
                refs_to_process = refs[1:]
            else:
                logger.info(f"Global duplicate (already used elsewhere): replacing all {len(refs)} occurrences")
                refs_to_process = refs

            replacement_count = 0
            for ref in refs_to_process:
                replacement_task = await self._schedule_replacement(ref, duplicate_path, content)
                if replacement_task:
                    replacements.append(replacement_task)
                    replacement_count += 1
                    logger.info(
                        f"Schedule Replacement {replacement_count}/{len(refs_to_process)}: {replacement_task['new_path']}"
                    )

        replacements.sort(key=lambda x: x["match"].start(), reverse=True)

        if replacements:
            logger.info(f"Executing {len(replacements)} image replacements in reverse order.")
            for rep in replacements:
                match, new_text = rep["match"], rep["new_text"]
                content = content[: match.start()] + new_text + content[match.end() :]

        return content

    async def _generate_replacement_image(self, original_path: str, context: str) -> Optional[str]:
        """
        Generate a replacement image based on the original path and context.
        Returns the new image path in /assets/xxx format.
        """
        path = Path(original_path)
        name, ext = path.stem, path.suffix

        # Generate variant file names
        self.variant_counters[name] += 1
        new_filename = f"{name}_variant_{self.variant_counters[name]}{ext}"

        # Generate image description
        description = await self._generate_image_description(context, original_path)

        # Reuse the generate_image method
        try:
            result = await self.generate_image(description=description, filename=new_filename, style="photorealistic")
            return f"/assets/{new_filename}" if result["status"] == "success" else None
        except Exception as e:
            logger.error(f"Failed to generate replacement image: {e}")
            return None

    async def _generate_image_description(self, context: str, original_path: str) -> str:
        """Generate image description based on context using LLM."""
        path = Path(original_path)
        filename = path.name

        if not self.llm:
            name = path.stem
            logger.warning("No LLM available, using filename-based description")
            return f"A {name.replace('-', ' ').replace('_', ' ')} image with photorealistic style"

        clean_context = " ".join(context.split())[:500] if len(context) > 500 else context

        prompt = f"""Based on the following context and original image filename, generate a detailed description for a new similar image.

        Context: {clean_context}
        Original image: {filename}

        **IMPORTANT**: Generate a description ONLY for the image named "{filename}". 
        If the context mentions other image filenames or paths, IGNORE them completely - they are NOT the target image.

        Generate a detailed, descriptive prompt for creating a similar but unique image. Focus on:
        - Visual elements and composition
        - Colors and style
        - Subject matter
        - Mood or atmosphere

        Make it different enough to be unique but similar in theme and purpose.
        Keep the description concise but descriptive (under 50 words)."""

        description = await self.llm.aask(prompt)
        return description.strip()

CheckUI.name: CheckUI

schemas.description: Check UI rendering quality through screenshot analysis and AI evaluation.

run.description: Check whether the current UI rendering matches the instruction after you have finished the devlopment and started the development server. Example instruction: - A 2048 game. - A KOL live streaming data dashboard web page.

CheckUI.code:
@register_tool(tags=["Check UI rendering"], include_functions=["run"])
class CheckUI(BaseModel):
    """Check UI rendering quality through screenshot analysis and AI evaluation."""

    img_llm: LLM = Field(default_factory=LLM, exclude=True)
    previewer: Previewer = Field(default_factory=Previewer)

    async def _recognize_screenshot(self, app_img_base64: str, instruction: str) -> tuple:
        """Analyze screenshot using AI to evaluate UI quality against instruction."""
        # Recognize screenshot image
        self.img_llm.model = "gpt-4o-mini"
        self.img_llm.max_completion_token = DEFAULT_MAX_COMPLETION_TOKENS
        check_report = await self.img_llm.aask(
            msg=CHECK_APP_STATE.format(instruction=instruction), images=[app_img_base64]
        )

        # parse app state information
        app_grade = re.search(r"<Render Grade>([\s\S]*?)<\/Render Grade>", check_report)

        if not app_grade:
            return None, None

        grade = int(app_grade.group(1).strip())

        await ThoughtReporter().async_report({"type": "render_grade", "grade": grade, "instruction": instruction})

        return check_report, grade

    async def run(self, instruction: str) -> str:
        """
        Check whether the current UI rendering matches the instruction after you have finished the devlopment and started the development server.

        Example instruction:
        - A 2048 game.
        - A KOL live streaming data dashboard web page.
        """

        passing_grade: float = 2
        skip_current_stage_msg = "Errors occurred during checking, end your development"
        # Get preview url and screenshot
        preview_info: dict = await self.previewer.get_preview_info()
        if not preview_info.get("screenshot_path") or not Path(preview_info.get("screenshot_path")).exists():
            logger.error("Not found Screenshot image.")
            return f"Not found Screenshot image. {skip_current_stage_msg}"
        logger.info(f"screenshot_path: {preview_info.get('screenshot_path')}")
        app_img_base64 = encode_image(preview_info.get("screenshot_path"))
        if not app_img_base64:
            logger.error("Encode screenshot failed.")
            return f"Encode screenshot failed. {skip_current_stage_msg}"

        # Recognize screenshot image
        try:
            check_report, grade = await self._recognize_screenshot(app_img_base64, instruction)
        except Exception as e:
            logger.error(f"Recognize screenshot failed. error: {e}")
            return f"Recognize screenshot failed. {skip_current_stage_msg}"

        # img_llm fail: end the role.
        if grade is None:
            logger.error("The image model failed in the task of recognizing the screenshot image.")
            return f"The image model failed in the task of recognizing the screenshot image. {skip_current_stage_msg}"

        # The goal was achieved: End the role.
        if grade >= passing_grade:
            logger.info(f"The Render Grade >= {passing_grade}.")
            return f"The Render Grade check report: {check_report}. The check has been passed, no further action is required, no need to ask the user."

        return f"{check_report}, Use tool `RoleZero.ask_human` to ask the user if fix is needed: 1) It's working fine. 2) Ask @Alex to fix the issue."

SecretManager.name: SecretManager

schemas.description: Usage docs: https://docs.pydantic.dev/2.9/concepts/models/ A base class for creating Pydantic models. Attributes: __class_vars__: The names of the class variables defined on the model. __private_attributes__: Metadata about the private attributes of the model. __signature__: The synthesized `__init__` [`Signature`][inspect.Signature] of the model. __pydantic_complete__: Whether model building is completed, or if there are still undefined fields. __pydantic_core_schema__: The core schema of the model. __pydantic_custom_init__: Whether the model has a custom `__init__` function. __pydantic_decorators__: Metadata containing the decorators defined on the model. This replaces `Model.__validators__` and `Model.__root_validators__` from Pydantic V1. __pydantic_generic_metadata__: Metadata for generic models; contains data used for a similar purpose to __args__, __origin__, __parameters__ in typing-module generics. May eventually be replaced by these. __pydantic_parent_namespace__: Parent namespace of the model, used for automatic rebuilding of models. __pydantic_post_init__: The name of the post-init method for the model, if defined. __pydantic_root_model__: Whether the model is a [`RootModel`][pydantic.root_model.RootModel]. __pydantic_serializer__: The `pydantic-core` `SchemaSerializer` used to dump instances of the model. __pydantic_validator__: The `pydantic-core` `SchemaValidator` used to validate instances of the model. __pydantic_extra__: A dictionary containing extra values, if [`extra`][pydantic.config.ConfigDict.extra] is set to `'allow'`. __pydantic_fields_set__: The names of fields explicitly set during instantiation. __pydantic_private__: Values of private attributes set on the model instance.

builtin_intg_authz.description: builtin integration authorization. If you need payment capabilities, Stripe is the first choice.
builtin_intg_authz.parameters: Args: intg_type (str): integration type, can be "stripe" Returns: None

request_secret.description: According to the user's needs, determine whether a third-party KEY is required to achieve the requirement, supplement the required SECRET information, and let the user fill in the format
request_secret.parameters: Args: secret_info (list[dict]): Contains multiple Secrets, each Secret includes the name and description of the Key. dict object must contain `KEY_NAME` and `KEY_DESC` fields. Returns: None Example: secret_info = [{"KEY_NAME": "PIXABAY_API_KEY", "KEY_DESC": "The API Key For Image Searching Engine Pixabay"}]

SecretManager.code:
@register_tool(include_functions=["builtin_intg_authz", "request_secret"])
class SecretManager(BaseModel):
    _reporter: ActionReporter = PrivateAttr(ActionReporter())

    async def builtin_intg_authz(self, intg_type: str):
        """builtin integration authorization. If you need payment capabilities, Stripe is the first choice.
        Args:
            intg_type (str): integration type, can be "stripe"
        Returns: None
        """
        logger.info(f"the user request builtin integration authorization: {intg_type}")
        support_intg_types = ["stripe"]
        if intg_type not in support_intg_types:
            raise ValueError(f"intg_type should be one of {support_intg_types}")
        async with self._reporter:
            await self._reporter.async_report({"type": "builtin_intg_authz", "data": {"intg_type": intg_type}})

    async def request_secret(self, secret_info: list[dict]):
        """According to the user's needs, determine whether a third-party KEY is required to achieve the requirement,
            supplement the required SECRET information, and let the user fill in the format
        Args:
            secret_info (list[dict]): Contains multiple Secrets, each Secret includes the name and description of the Key.
                                      dict object must contain `KEY_NAME` and `KEY_DESC` fields.
        Returns: None
        Example: secret_info = [{"KEY_NAME": "PIXABAY_API_KEY", "KEY_DESC": "The API Key For Image Searching Engine Pixabay"}]
        """
        if isinstance(secret_info, str):
            secret_info = json.loads(secret_info)

        def _check_fields(info: dict):
            must_keys = set(["KEY_NAME", "KEY_DESC"])
            diff = must_keys.difference(info.keys())
            if diff:
                raise KeyError(f"secret_info (list[dict]): dict must contain keys: {must_keys}")

        for info in secret_info:
            _check_fields(info)

        async with self._reporter:
            await self._reporter.async_report({"type": "request_secret", "data": secret_info})

ImageGetter.name: ImageGetter

schemas.description: A tool to get/create/process images.

get.description: Get an image either by searching online or generating with AI.
get.parameters: Args: search_term (str): Search query or image description. Must be in English. image_save_path (str): Path where the image will be saved. Must be a absolute path to the public folder. mode (str): How to obtain the image: - "search": Search online (falls back to AI generation if search fails) - "create": Generate using DALL-E 3 Returns: str: Relative path to the saved image (public/ prefix removed) Raises: ValueError: If an invalid mode is specified RuntimeError: If image retrieval fails

process.description: Process an existing image with filters.

Must be a absolute path to the public folder. mode (str): Processing mode to apply: - "rembg": Remove image background Returns: str: Relative path to the processed image (public/ prefix removed)

validate_and_replace_images.description: Parse the content and check if it contains invalid images paths/URLs. If it does, replace them with valid images.
validate_and_replace_images.parameters: Args: content: The content to process path: Optional file path for logging purposes Returns: str: Content with invalid images replaced

ImageGetter.code:
@register_tool(include_functions=["get", "process", "validate_and_replace_images"])
class ImageGetter(BaseModel):
    """
    A tool to get/create/process images.
    """

    search_term_model_name: str = "gpt-4o-mini"
    llm: LLM = Field(default_factory=LLM, exclude=True)
    model_config = ConfigDict(arbitrary_types_allowed=True)
    image_provider: BaseImageProvider = Field(
        default=None,
        exclude=True,
        description="The image getter to use. Choose from Pixabay, Unsplash, or Unsplash API. Defaults to Unsplash API.",
    )

    project_dir: Optional[Path] = Field(default=None, exclude=True)
    # Limit concurrent HTTP probe requests
    http_head_semaphore: asyncio.Semaphore = Field(default_factory=lambda: asyncio.Semaphore(10), exclude=True)

    @model_validator(mode="after")
    def set_provider(self) -> "ImageGetter":
        self.llm.model = self.search_term_model_name
        self.llm.max_completion_token = DEFAULT_MAX_COMPLETION_TOKENS
        if self.image_provider is None:
            image_search_config = Config.default().image_search
            api_type = image_search_config.api_type
            params = image_search_config.model_dump(exclude=("api_type",), exclude_none=True, exclude_defaults=True)
            if api_type == "unsplash":
                self.image_provider = UnsplashApi(**params, project_dir=self.project_dir)
            elif api_type == "pixabay":
                self.image_provider = PixabayAPI(**params, project_dir=self.project_dir)
            else:
                raise ValueError("No image provider configured. Set image_search.api_type to 'unsplash' or 'pixabay'.")
        return self

    def update_project_dir(self, new_project_dir: Path) -> None:
        """Update project_dir for both ImageGetter and its image_provider.

        Args:
            new_project_dir: The new project directory path to set.
        """
        self.project_dir = new_project_dir
        if self.image_provider:
            self.image_provider.project_dir = new_project_dir

    @classmethod
    def is_available(cls) -> bool:
        config = Config.default()
        api_type = config.image_search.api_type
        api_key = config.image_search.api_key
        has_key = False
        if isinstance(api_key, list):
            has_key = any(bool(k) for k in api_key)
        else:
            has_key = bool(api_key)
        return (api_type in ("unsplash", "pixabay")) and has_key

    async def get(self, search_term: str, image_save_path: str, mode="search") -> str:
        """Get an image either by searching online or generating with AI.

        Args:
            search_term (str): Search query or image description. Must be in English.
            image_save_path (str): Path where the image will be saved. Must be a absolute path to the public folder.
            mode (str): How to obtain the image:
                - "search": Search online (falls back to AI generation if search fails)
                - "create": Generate using DALL-E 3

        Returns:
            str: Relative path to the saved image (public/ prefix removed)

        Raises:
            ValueError: If an invalid mode is specified
            RuntimeError: If image retrieval fails
        """
        return await self.image_provider.get(search_term, image_save_path, mode)

    async def process(self, image_path: str, image_save_path: str, mode: str = "rembg") -> str:
        """Process an existing image with filters.

        Args:
            image_path (str): Path to the source image
            image_save_path (str): Path where processed image will be saved. Must be a absolute path to the public folder.
            mode (str): Processing mode to apply:
                - "rembg": Remove image background

        Returns:
            str: Relative path to the processed image (public/ prefix removed)
        """
        return await self.image_provider.process(image_path, image_save_path, mode)

    async def get_search_term(self, context: str, img_path: str) -> str:
        """Get the search term from the context. Use llm to infer the search term from the context."""
        prompt = SEARCH_TERM_PROMPT.format(context=context, img_path=img_path)
        response = await self.llm.aask(prompt)
        content_match = re.search(r"<content>(.*?)</content>", response)
        if content_match:
            return content_match.group(1)
        else:
            # Fallback if the LLM doesn't follow the format
            return response.strip()

    async def _invalid_img_replace(self, img_path: str, content: str) -> tuple[str, bool]:
        """
        Internal method to replace invalid image path with a valid one and return status.

        Args:
            img_path: the image path string to check and potentially replace
            content: the full content containing the image path
            Uses self.project_dir to resolve local files

        Returns:
            tuple: (valid_image_path, was_invalid)
                - valid_image_path: the valid image path (original if valid, or new if replaced)
                - was_invalid: True if the original path was invalid
        """
        # Image path is already clean (no quotes from regex)
        clean_img_path = img_path

        # Check if the image URL/path is valid
        is_valid = False
        if clean_img_path.startswith("http"):
            # Use robust HTTP probe (HEAD with retry, fallback to GET on 405)
            async with self.http_head_semaphore:
                is_valid = await probe_http_image_is_valid(clean_img_path, timeout_sec=5, max_retries=2)
        else:
            # Remove leading slash if it exists to ensure path is treated as relative
            if self.project_dir is None:
                raise RuntimeError("project_dir must be set before validating local images")

            rel_path = Path(clean_img_path.lstrip("/"))
            public_rel = Path("public") / rel_path
            local_path = self.project_dir / public_rel
            try:
                with Image.open(local_path) as img:
                    img_format = img.format
                    is_valid = img_format is not None
            except Exception as e:
                logger.warning(f"Invalid image: {public_rel} with error: {e}")
                is_valid = False

            # Fallback: if not found/invalid under public path, search by filename under project_dir
            # If any file with the same basename is a valid image, consider it valid
            if not is_valid:
                try:
                    file_name = public_rel.name
                    for candidate in self.project_dir.rglob(file_name):
                        try:
                            with Image.open(candidate) as img:
                                if img.format:
                                    is_valid = True
                                    logger.info(f"Found image by filename in project_dir: {candidate} for {public_rel}")
                                    break
                        except Exception:
                            # Skip unreadable/non-image files with same name
                            continue
                except Exception as search_err:
                    logger.debug(f"Filename search failed for {public_rel}: {search_err}")

        # If valid, return original path
        if is_valid:
            return img_path, False

        # Use llm to infer the search term from the context
        context = retrieve_img_context(img_path, content, window_size=200)
        search_term = await self.get_search_term(context, img_path)
        img_dir_path = Path("public") / "images"
        if self.project_dir is None:
            raise RuntimeError("project_dir must be set before creating new images")
        (self.project_dir / img_dir_path).mkdir(parents=True, exist_ok=True)

        # Clean the search term by removing non-alphanumeric characters
        filename = re.sub(r"[^a-zA-Z0-9]", "", search_term)
        # Avoid filename conflict
        extension = ".jpg"
        proposed = img_dir_path / f"{filename}{extension}"
        if not filename or (self.project_dir / proposed).exists():
            new_rel_path = img_dir_path / f"photo{int(time.time())}{extension}"
        else:
            new_rel_path = proposed
        new_img_path = new_rel_path.as_posix()

        try:
            relative_path = await self.get(search_term=search_term, image_save_path=new_img_path, mode="search")
            # Strip public prefix for projects using build tools (Vite, etc.) that map public/ to root
            # Check if project has a public directory (covers shadcn-ui, presentation, prototype_template, etc.)
            if self.project_dir and (self.project_dir / "public").exists():
                relative_path = strip_public_prefix(relative_path)
            return f"{relative_path}", True
        except Exception as e:
            logger.warning(f"Failed to get image for {search_term}: {e}")
            return img_path, True  # Return original but mark as invalid

    @staticmethod
    def _is_potential_image(url: str) -> bool:
        """Simplified check: common image extensions and special-case hosts allowing no extension."""
        if not url:
            return False
        u = url.strip()

        # Special-case hosts: even without extension are considered images
        if u.startswith("http") and any(h in u for h in IMAGE_HOSTS_ALLOW_NO_EXT):
            return True

        # Exclude common non-resource schemes to avoid data:, blob: and JS links
        if u.startswith(NON_RESOURCE_SCHEMES):
            return False

        return bool(IMAGE_SUFFIX_PATTERN.search(u))

    async def validate_and_replace_images(self, content: str, path: str = None) -> str:
        """
        Parse the content and check if it contains invalid images paths/URLs.
        If it does, replace them with valid images.

        Args:
            content: The content to process
            path: Optional file path for logging purposes

        Returns:
            str: Content with invalid images replaced
        """
        # Only match "explicit image references" in the content to reduce false positives, supporting:
        #  - Absolute URLs: http(s)://... (even without an extension, extract first, then filter/allow by _is_potential_image)
        #  - Relative paths: paths starting with /, ./, or ../
        #  - Bare filenames/paths: must contain an image extension (see IMAGE_EXT_RE), may include query strings/fragments (? or #)
        #  - Non-resource schemes (data:, blob:, javascript:, mailto:) are excluded by _is_potential_image
        #  - Special-case hosts (see IMAGE_HOSTS_ALLOW_NO_EXT) links without extensions are allowed by _is_potential_image
        urls = [
            m.group("url")
            for m in CANDIDATE_IMAGE_URL_PATTERN.finditer(content)
            if self._is_potential_image(m.group("url"))
        ]

        if not urls:
            logger.info(f"No image contexts found in {path or 'content'}")
            return content

        # Deduplicate and validate/propose replacements concurrently
        unique_urls: list[str] = list(dict.fromkeys(urls))
        url_to_result: dict[str, tuple[str, bool]] = dict(
            zip(
                unique_urls,
                await asyncio.gather(*[self._invalid_img_replace(u, content) for u in unique_urls]),
            )
        )

        # Use regex substitution with a callback for safe, position-independent replacements
        def _sub_replacer(m: re.Match) -> str:
            old_url = m.group("url")
            new_url, was_invalid = url_to_result.get(old_url, (old_url, False))
            return new_url if was_invalid and new_url != old_url else m.group(0)

        new_content = CANDIDATE_IMAGE_URL_PATTERN.sub(_sub_replacer, content)

        # Compute counts based on original URL occurrences
        num_invalid_images = sum(1 for u in urls if url_to_result.get(u, (u, False))[1])
        num_converted_images = sum(
            1 for u in urls if url_to_result.get(u, (u, False))[1] and url_to_result.get(u, (u, False))[0] != u
        )

        logger.info(
            f"Processed {len(urls)} image refs. Detected {num_invalid_images} invalid refs. Fixed {num_converted_images} refs."
        )
        return new_content

This page must instantly communicate that RetreatsOS is not just a management system —
it is a creative accelerator.
A place where retreat creators don't start from a blank page. They start from expert-built templates that shorten planning from months to minutes.

Inspiration + clarity + momentum.

A narrative structure

Women's Retreats

Spiritual

Creativity

Detox & Longevity

A short tagline (Flow, Ocean, Community)

Daily flow included

Not generic

Not fluffy

Each template comes from real retreat strategy

Built to convert, organize, and deliver a full guest journey

Side-by-side screenshot mockups of the Retreat Builder loaded with a chosen template.

Serious, premium, confident.

Buttons:

Start Free

Calm

Premium

Reliable

Non-salesy

Expert-driven

Structured

Hopeful

This is not a marketplace.

RetreatsOS gives you a head start. Instead of creating your retreat from scratch, you begin with expert-crafted templates that provide structure, clarity and a complete guest experience blueprint.
From Yoga & Mindfulness to Surf, Corporate Wellness, Couples retreats and more — each template is built to help you launch faster, communicate better, and execute with confidence.
Every template includes a full narrative guide, a daily flow, pricing logic, marketing angles and operational checklists, giving you everything you need to turn your idea into a real, functioning retreat.
Choose a template that matches your vision, make it your own, and start building in minutes. Retreat creation has never been this clear, this simple, or this inspiring.    רק אנגלית

[Message] from User to Alex: Templates Library — עמוד תבניות ריטריטים מוכנות

הוא הופך את RetreatsOS למוצר חזק פי 3, כי הוא מראה ללקוח:
“אתה לא מתחיל מאפס. יש לך תבניות מוכנות של מומחים”.

להלן בריף מלא, חד, עשיר, ברמה בינלאומית — מוכן למעצב / UX / קופירייטר.

Templates Library — Full Strategic UX / Content Brief
Purpose of This Page

This page must instantly communicate that RetreatsOS is not just a management system —
it is a creative accelerator.
A place where retreat creators don't start from a blank page. They start from expert-built templates that shorten planning from months to minutes.

This page should feel like entering a “Retreat Marketplace,” but premium, minimal, and calm.

The vibe:
Inspiration + clarity + momentum.

Core Message

“You bring the vision. We give you the structure.”

RetreatsOS provides a library of professionally-designed retreat templates that cover every style, every niche, every audience.
Each template includes:

A narrative structure

A daily schedule layout

A pricing logic blueprint

A marketing angle

A positioning statement

A guest experience flow

A full operational checklist

Your visitor must feel:
“I can build a real retreat today.”

Structure of the Page
1. Hero Section — “Start With a Template. Build a Retreat Today.”

Headline:
Retreat templates built for creators who want clarity and momentum.

Subline:
Choose from professionally-crafted retreat frameworks — Yoga, Mindfulness, Surf, Couples, Corporate Wellness and more.

CTA buttons:

Explore Templates

Start Free

Visual:
Grid of 3–4 template thumbnails floating subtly, soft shadows, premium minimal aesthetic.

Vibe: Inspiring, premium, structured.

2. Category Navigation

A horizontal bar with filter pills:

Yoga

Meditation & Mindfulness

Surf & Adventure

Corporate Wellness

Couples

Women's Retreats

Spiritual

Creativity

Detox & Longevity

Minimalist design — no clutter.

3. Template Grid (The Heart of the Page)

Each template tile contains:

A name (e.g., 7-Day Surf & Soul Retreat)

A short tagline (Flow, Ocean, Community)

A visual hero image (clean, premium)

Key features summarized in 3 bullets:

Daily flow included

Pricing model included

Marketing angle included

Hover effect:
Tile gently lifts, revealing deeper details.

Click = Template Details Page (we will define this later).

Important:
Grid must feel tight, modern, SaaS-level, inspiring.

4. Highlight Block — “More than designs — Real operational frameworks.”

Short copy explaining the power of templates:

Not generic

Not fluffy

Each template comes from real retreat strategy

Built to convert, organize, and deliver a full guest journey

Visual:
Side-by-side screenshot mockups of the Retreat Builder loaded with a chosen template.

Tone:
Serious, premium, confident.

5. Example Template Breakdown

A section showing one spotlight template and visual breakdown:

“Inside the Yoga & Mindfulness Template”

Columns:

Daily Flow: Morning–Evening rhythm

Marketing Positioning: Calm, nature-driven, emotional release

Audience: Beginners + intermediate

Pricing Logic: Tiered early-bird

Operational Checklist: Venue, meals, equipment, instructor cadence

Purpose:
Show depth. Show seriousness. Prove this isn’t Canva fluff — this is real retreat architecture.

6. Trust and Authority Block

Title:
Templates crafted by retreat strategists.

Subcopy:
Every template is informed by 10+ years of industry expertise, real retreat creators, and wellness professionals.

Add minimal icons:

Research-based

Designed for guest psychology

Built for execution

Optimized for conversion

7. Call to Action — “Start With a Template Today”

Short, powerful, premium CTA.

Headline:
Build your retreat in hours, not months.

Buttons:

Browse All Templates

Start Free

Tone & Emotional Layer

The page must feel:

Calm

Premium

Reliable

Non-salesy

Expert-driven

Structured

Hopeful

This is not a marketplace.
זה לא אתר "בחירת ריטריטים".
זה אתר מקצועי שבא לתת בהירות ואומץ ליוצר ריטריט שהולך לאיבוד.

<Basic Info>
{role_info}
</Basic Info>

{domain_info}
</Domain Info>

<Data Structure>
class Task(BaseModel):
    task_id: str = ""

    instruction: str = ""
    task_type: str = ""

</Data Structure>

</Available Task Types>

<Available Commands>
{available_commands}
Special Command: Use <end></end> to indicate completion of all requirements and termination of the entire workflow.
</Available Commands>

<Example>
{example}
</Example>

<Instruction>
{instruction}

You may use any of the available commands. You may output multiple commands, they will be executed sequentially.
If the task requires writing multiple files, you should output multiple commands to write files instead of writing one by one.
If you finish current task, you will automatically take the next task in the existing plan, use Plan.finish_current_task, DON'T append a new task.
Review the latest plan's outcome. If your completed task matches the current, consider it finished.
In your response, include at least one command. Only use <end></end> when all requirements are met, and please use RoleZero.reply_to_human immediately before <end></end> to report completion.
Do NOT use <end></end> when waiting for user input or clarification.
</Instruction>

<Output>
You should output a list of commands, follow the format below, replace the <ClassName.method_name> and <args_name> with the actual name.

Some thoughts...

</args_name1>

</args_name2>
</ClassName.method_name>
